display_name: Acculturation Score - MESA
description: This is a summary acculturation score based on nativity, language spoken at home, and years of residence in the U.S. It is defined as the sum of nativity subscore and language subscore.

display_name: Age of immigration among participants who were not born in US mainland (50 US States + DC)
description: The age of immigration is defined as if participant was not born in the US 50 states, then the age of immigration is equal to the participant's age minus years lived in the US or if participant was born in the US 50 states, then the age of immigration is equal to missing.

display_name: Background with Other reclassified
description: The self-identification with a Hispanic/Latino cultural group allowed for selection of an 'other' designation. This variable groups the test responses of 'other' for variations of 'Dominican' so that undercounts do not occur for that group.

display_name: Background with Other reclassified (collapsed categories)
description: Variable collapses 'Central' and 'South American' categories into one group and the 'Other' and 'More than one heritage' categories into one group.

display_name: 7-level re-classification of Hispanic/Latino Background
description: Variable combined 'Other' and 'More than one heritage' categories into one group.

display_name: Ethnic identity score
description: Variable indicates the degree of ethnic identity.

display_name: Immigrant generation (2 categories)
description: This variable determines the participants immigrant generation status based on a combination of the country of origin of the participant, maternal and paternal parents, and/or the maternal and paternal grandparents.

display_name: Immigrant generation (4 categories)
description: This variable determines the participant's immigrant generation status based on a combination of the country of origin of the participant, maternal and paternal parents, and/or the maternal and paternal grandparents.

display_name: Language preference
description: This variable determines which language was preferred to be used for the baseline examination.

display_name: Language Subscore - MESA
description: This is a language subscore of the acculturation score similar to the one used in MESA.

display_name: Nativity Subscore - MESA
description: This is a nativity subscore of the acculturation score similar to the one used in MESA.

display_name: Race Group (self-report)
description: The self-identification with a race group.

display_name: Short acculturation scale for Hispanics-language subscale
description: This variable indicates the degree of language acculturation.

display_name: SASH ethic social relations subscale
description: This variable indicates the degree of social acculturation.

display_name: Cross-Classification of Center and Hispanic/Latino Background
description: This variable is the self-identification with a Hispanic/Latino cultural group crossed by field center.

display_name: Cross-Classification of Center and Hispanic Latino Background, 45+ Years Only
description: This variable is the self-identification with a Hispanic/Latino cultural group, based on a sub-cohort of participants 45+ years old, crossed by field center and grouped into categories.

display_name: Born in mainland US (50 States + DC)
description: This variable groups the place of birth of the participant to the United States (50 states only) or other place of birth.

display_name: US Born (including territories)
description: This variable groups the place of birth of the participant to the United States (50 states and US territories which includes Puerto-Rico, Guam, and Virgin Islands) or other place of birth.

display_name: Years lived in US
description: This variable defines years lived in the US as if the participant was not born in the US, then the years lived in the US is equal to the response of PIEA7 or if participant was born in the US, then the years lived in the US is equal to the participant's age.

display_name: 2-level grouped years lived in the US (50 States)
description: This variable is grouped and defined as living less than 10 years in the US or living 10 years or more in the US.

Any permission for public use of data
description: Thi variable combines the 3 permission variables to determine whether or not a study participant gave any permission for public use of data.

display_name: Center
description: This variable is the field center that was derived from the city of origin.

display_name: Participant's Field Center - numeric
description: This variable is the field center that was derived from the city of origin.

display_name: Permission for for-profit use of data
description: This variable determines whether or not a study participant gave permission for use for for-profit use of study data.

display_name: Consent to Participate in HCHS\SOL Study
description: This variable determines whether or not a study participant consented to participate in the baseline examination study.

display_name: Days between HCHS clinic visit and Sueno clinic visit
DNA Available
description: This variable determines whether or not a study participant had blood draws successfully conducted without incidents or problems for tubes 4 and 5 to make DNA available to investigators associated or not associated to HCHS/SOL and specialized laboratories.

display_name: Permission for investigators outside HCHS/SOL
description: This variable determines whether or not a study participant gave permission for use for investigators outside HCHS/SOL.

display_name: Age greater than or equal to 65 or less than 18
AHI greater than 50
Ineligible Hispanic background for site
Sueno visit date more than 31+ months since SOL visit
Narcolepsy diagnosis
Treated for OSA
Annual Follow-Up Eligibity (minimum set of forms present)
description: This variable defines a participant as meeting all requirements to determine if eligible for annual follow-up.

display_name: Full consent for genotyping
description: This variable determines whether or not a study participant fully consented to genotyping for use with investigators associated or not associated to HCHS/SOL and specialized laboratories.

display_name: Permission for non-profit use of data
description: This variable determines whether or not a study participant gave permission for non-profit use of study data.

display_name: Random BioLINCC ID for LAD
Eligible Sueno participant
Visit Number
Body Mass Index (BMI)
Body Mass Index at the Sueno clinic visit, using the SOL height
4-level grouped Body Mass Index - WHO
description: This variable is created using the calculated body mass index to define categories based on current WHO (World Health Organization) classifications

display_name: 4-level grouped Body Mass Index - WHO at the Sueno visit using SOL height
description: This variable is created using the calculated body mass index to define categories based on current WHO (World Health Organization) classifications

display_name: 6-level grouped Body Mass Index - WHO
description: This variable is created using the calculated body mass index to define categories based on current WHO (World Health Organization) classifications

display_name: 6-level grouped Body Mass Index - WHO at Sueno visit using SOL height
description: This variable is created using the calculated body mass index to define categories based on current WHO (World Health Organization) classifications

display_name: Height (corrected)
description: During two time periods the standing height as measured at the Bronx site was incorrect due to a mis-mounted stadiometer used in measuring all participants. The derived variable was implemented based on a recommendation from the Quality Control subcommittee.

display_name: Waist to Hip Ratio
Overall Ankle Branchial Index (occlusion failure included)
description: Ankle Brachial Index (ABI) is the average ankle to arm systolic pressures as measured from the left and right sides. The higher of the two ankle measures on the same side is divided by the higher of the two systolic arm pressures to derive the right and left side ABI values. The overall ABI is the mean of those two measurements.

display_name: 4-level grouped Ankle Brachial Index (occ. failure incl.)
description: This variable groups left and right ABI into 4 categories.

display_name: Left Ankle Branchial Index (occ. failure incl.)
description: Ankle Brachial Index (ABI) is the average ankle to arm systolic pressures as measured from the left and right sides. The higher of the two ankle measures on the same side is divided by the higher of the two systolic arm pressures to derive the right and left side ABI values.

display_name: Left 4-level grouped Ankle Brachial Index (occ. failure incl.)
description: This variable groups left and right ABI into 4 categories.

display_name: Right Ankle Branchial Index (occ. failure incl.)
description: Ankle Brachial Index (ABI) is the average ankle to arm systolic pressures as measured from the left and right sides. The higher of the two ankle measures on the same side is divided by the higher of the two systolic arm pressures to derive the right and left side ABI values.

display_name: Right 4-level grouped Ankle Brachial Index (occ. failure incl.)
description: This variable groups left and right ABI into 4 categories.

display_name: Alcohol Use
Alcohol Use Disorder Risk
description: Based on gender-specific cutoffs for weekly alcohol use provided by the National Institute for Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism, this variable provides a risk level for developing an alcohol use disorder (craving, loss of control, physical dependence, tolerance, etc.)

display_name: Alcohol Use Drinking Level
description: Using the weekly alcohol use cutoffs from alcohol_use_disorder, this variable combines never users and former users into a group called 'no current use'. Definitions of 'low level use' and 'high level use' correspond to those of 'low risk drinker' and 'at-risk drinker' from alcohol_use_disorder.

display_name: Cerebrovascular Disease and Carotid Revascularization, self-report
description: This variable checks for medical history of stroke, mini-stroke or TIA, or balloon angioplasty or surgery to the arteries in the neck.

display_name: Cerebrovascular Disease and Carotid Revascularization, self-reported at the Sueno clinic visit
description: This variable checks for medical history of stroke, mini-stroke or TIA, or balloon angioplasty or surgery to the arteries in the neck.

display_name: Self-reported CHD
description: This variable combines the self-reports of coronary revascularization or heart attack.

display_name: Self-reported CHD at the Sueno visit
description: This variable combines the self-reports of coronary revascularization or heart attack.

display_name: Cigarette Pack Years
description: This variable calculates the cigarette pack years as the number of exposure years multiplied by the average number of cigarettes smoked per day.

display_name: Cigarette Pack Years (3-level, cutoff=10)
description: This variable groups cigaratte use into 3 categories

display_name: Cigarette Use
Adjusted Cigarettes per Year
description: This variable calculates the cigarette years as the number of exposure years multiplied by the average number of cigarettes smoked per day.

display_name: Intermittent Claudication - either leg
description: This variable defines intermittent claudication being present in either leg

display_name: Current Smoker (from CIGARETTE_USE)
description: This variable is an indicator to denote current smoker status using the variable cigarette_use.

display_name: Framingham CVD composite criterion
description: This variable is an indicator that defines a composite CVD definition based on the Framingham Study criterion.

display_name: Diabetes Diagnosis
description: This variable describes the diagnoses of diabetes and whether it was diagnosed before baseline, not diagnosed before baseline but possibly detected from lab data, or as non-diabetic.

display_name: Family History of Diabetes
description: This variable describes the family history of diabetes.

display_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes ver.1
description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes.

display_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes - ADA
description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes based on American Diabetes Association definition.

display_name: Diabetes Indicator - ADA
description: This variable is based on the Diabetes variable (version 2) stages of diabetes based on American Diabetes Association definition.

display_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes - includes self-report
description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes based on American Diabetes Association definition with an additional self-report criterion.

display_name: 4-level grouped diabetes (none/pre/treated/untreated)
description: This variable assesses diabetes using variable diabetes3 and medication use based on variables muea33c and med_antidaib.

display_name: 3-level grouped Diabetes - Lab
description: This variable describes the stages of diabetes.

display_name: Diabetes - self report only
description: This variable indicates a self-report of diabetes.

display_name: Diabetes - self report only, collected during the sueno clinic visit
description: This variable indicates a self-report of diabetes.

display_name: Diabetes (at Sueno visit) derived from SOL diagnosis and Sueno diabetes mellitus variables
Diabetes awareness at baseline
description: This variable describes the awareness of diabetes. Defined only for self-reported diabetics.

display_name: Diabetes awareness at the Sueno visit
description: This variable describes the awareness of diabetes. Defined only for self-reported diabetics.

display_name: Diabetes controlled: DM Classified at Baseline and A1C < 7%
description: This variable indicates controlled diabetes. Defined only for diabetics.

display_name: Doctor/HCP number of visits in past 12 months
description: This variable defines grouped categories for the number of times a participant has visited the doctor in the last 12 months.

display_name: At least one relative had report of angina
description: This variable combines self-report of angina for immediate family relatives, i.e. mother, father, and sibling(s).

display_name: At least one relative had report of CABG or angioplasty
description: This variable combines self-report of variable cabg or angioplasty for immediate family relatives, i.e. mother, father, and sibling(s).

display_name: At least one relative had report of heart attack
description: This variable combines self-report of heart attack for immediate family relatives, i.e. mother, father, and sibling(s).

display_name: Adjusted Years Smoked
description: This variable calculates the years a participant smoked cigarettes. This is calculated using the difference from the age the participant began smoking to either the participant's age at baseline examination or the age that the participant quit smoking (if applicable).

display_name: Family history of CHD including self-reported angina
description: This variable combines the self-reports of angina, heart attack, or procedure (angioplasty, stent, bypass) for immediate family relatives, i.e. mother, father, and sibling(s).

display_name: Family history of stroke
description: This variable combines the self-reports of stroke for immediate family relatives, i.e. mother, father, and sibling(s).

display_name: Framingham CVD - 10 year risk (w/lab predictors)
description: This variable defines the Framingham CVD 10 year risk using lab predictors based on the Framingham Study criterion for participants. Individuals 30 to 74 years old only.

display_name: Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) in SI units (mmol/mol), nearest integer
HOMA index of Beta Cell Function
description: This variable defines the Homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance.

display_name: HOMA index of Insulin Resistance
description: This variable defines the Homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance.

display_name: Awareness of Hypertension - NHANES
description: This variable is defined by the self-report of doctor's diagnosis of hypertension for those who were defined as having hypertension using the NHANES definition only.

display_name: Control of Hypertension - NHANES
description: This variable is defined for participants whose blood pressure are below the cutoff of 140/90 (both systolic and diastolic must be less than the cutoff values) for those who were defined as having hypertension using the NHANES definition only and also indicated whether or not they were receiving treatment for hypertension.

display_name: Treatment of Hypertension - NHANES
description: This variable is defined by the participant's self-report awareness of hypertension and self-report use of antihypertensive medications for those who were defined as having hypertension using the NHANES definition only.

display_name: Hypertension (BP>=140/90 and Med Use)
description: Hypertension is defined here if the systolic or diastolic blood pressure is greater than or equal to 140/90 or if the participant is currently taking antihypertensive medications.

display_name: Hypertension using NHANES definition
description: Hypertension is defined here using the following NHANES definition: if the systolic or diastolic blood pressure is greater than or equal to 140/90 or if the participant self-reported as currently taking antihypertensive medications.

display_name: 4-level grouped hypertension (none/pre/treated/untreated)
description: This variable classifies participants into 4 categories based on hypertension and hypertensive.

display_name: Hypertension at the Sueno visit as derived from the SOL diagnosis and Sueno hypertension variables
description: Hypertension is defined here if the systolic or diastolic blood pressure is greater than or equal to 140/90 or if the participant is currently taking antihypertensive medications.

display_name: Metabolic Syndrome - IDF definition
description: The International Diabetes Federation (IDF) definition emphasizes central obesity because it is 'independently' associated with each of the other metabolic syndrome components, as well as insulin resistance.

display_name: Metabolic Syndrome - NCEP ATP III
description: The following definition of metabolic syndrome is based on the updated Adult Treat Panel III (ATP III) of the National Cholesterol Education Program (NCEP) guidelines.

display_name: Metabolic Syndrome w/Self-Reported Meds - NCEP ATP III
description: This variable incorporates the original variable mets_ncep definition with changes to include self-reported medication use instead of scanned/transcribed medication use.

display_name: MI defined by ECG results
description: This variable checks some ECG measures to detect possible old MIs.

display_name: Prevalent Coronary Heart Disease, including self-report
description: This variable combines ECG reports of possible old MI as well as self-report of angina, heart attack, or procedure (angioplasty, stent, bypass).

display_name: Prevalent Coronary Heart Disease
description: This variable combines ECG reports of possible old MI as well as self-report of heart attack, or procedure (angioplasty, stent, bypass).

display_name: Prevalent Stroke, self report
description: This variable checks for self-report medical history of stroke.

display_name: Prevalent Stroke, self-reported
Prevalent Stroke or TIA, self report
description: This variable checks for medical history or mini-stroke or TIA.

display_name: Prevalent Stroke or TIA, self-reported
Total Weekly Alcohol Consumption
description: This variable determines the total alcohol intake as the numbers of drinks per week only for current drinkers.

display_name: Periodontitis Severity using CDC/AAP Grades
description: The HCHS/SOL used a comprehensive full mouth examination protocol examining six sites per tooth in up to 28 teeth yielding up to 168 sites per person. For the purpose of this study, four outcome measures were reported based on the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the American Academy of Periodontology (CDC/AAP) case definition of periodontitis at four severity thresholds. These classifications are designed for population-based surveillance of periodontal disease and are based on measures of clinical periodontal clinical attachment level (CAL) and probing pocket depth (PD).

display_name: Percentage Interproximal Sites Positive for Periodontitis
description: This is an additional method of describing the extent of disease in the mouth.

display_name: Periodontal Disease - NIDCR
description: The NIDCR cites the prevalence of periodontal disease based on dental examination probing measurements. To be classified as having periodontal disease there is at least one toother with Attachment Loss (AL) 3mm or greater and Pocket Depth (PD) 4mm or greater.

display_name: Cohort Year (from Household Address Wave Assignment)
description: This variable is an indicator of household sample address allocation and distribution for HCHS/SOL recruitment.

display_name: Sample List-level Hispanic Household Frame Counts
description: This variable is the sample design list household frame count variable used in statistical analyses.

display_name: List Address Record Assigned
description: This variable is the sample design variable used in statistical analyses.

display_name: BG-level Hispanic Household Frame Counts
description: This variable is the sample design clustering household frame count variable used in statistical analyses.

display_name: Primary Sampling Unit ID
description: This variable is the sample design clustering variable used in statistical analyses as the cluster variable that is combination of the field center and selected block group identifier.

display_name: Stratification Variable ID
description: This variable is the sample design stratification variable used in statistical analyses as the stratum variable that is a combination of field center, Hispanic household proportion, and SES.

display_name: Stratum-level Hispanic Household Frame Counts
description: This variable is the sample design stratification household frame variable used in statistical analyses.

display_name: Expanded Census 2010 Final Calibrated Trimmed Nonresponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10/27/2011)
description: The calibrated sample weight is the calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted reciprocal of a participants probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study. The trimmed, nonresponse adjusted sample weights were calibrated using first the 7-category Hispanic Background distribution and then the 12-category age group/gender distribution using the 2010 Decennial Census. This variable is used for analyses purposes only.

display_name: FC-specific Normalized Census 2010 Calibrated Trimmed NonResponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10/27/2011)
description: The FC-specific normalized sample weight is the field center specific normalized, calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted (household and person-level) reciprocal of a participants probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study. The calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted sample weights were normalized using the weighted mean divided by weighted standard deviation calculated for each field center separately and used to normalize the expanded calibrated sample weights (WEIGHT_Final_Norm_Center). This final sample weight variable is used for analyses purposes only when the subpopulation is restricted to within a single site.

display_name: Overall Sample Normalized Census 2010 Calibrated Trimmed NonResponse Adjusted Final Weights - Year 1-3 (frozen as of 10/27/2011)
description: The normalized sample weight is the overall normalized, calibrated, trimmed, nonresponse adjusted (household and person-level) reciprocal of a participants probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study. The base sample weights, i.e. the reciprocal of a participants probability of selection into the HCHS/SOL study, were first adjusted by household-level and person-level non-response. The non-response adjusted sample weights were then trimmed using the selected average percentile that minimizes model MSE within each field center. All sample weights that fell above the selected percentile were trimmed to the selected percentile and the trimmed difference was evenly distributed among all of the non-trimmed sample weights. The trimmed, non-response adjusted sample weights were then calibrated using first the 7-category Hispanic Background distribution and then the 12-category age group/gender distribution using the 2010 Decennial Census. Finally, these calibrated, trimmed, non-response adjusted sample weights were normalized using the weighted mean divided by weighted standard deviation of the entire HCHS/SOL sample to normalize the expanded calibrated sample weights (WEIGHT_Final_Norm_Overall). This final sample weight variable is used for analyses purposes only.

Physical activity level (low, mod, high)
description: This variable assigns a value of 1 assigned to those with high total physical activity levels, a value of 2 to those with moderate total physical activity levels and a value of 3 to those with low total physical activity levels.

display_name: GPAQ - Total physical (moderate) activity (min/week)
description: This variable that finds the average amount of time spent per week doing moderate physical activity.

display_name: GPAQ - Total physical activity (min/week)
description: This variable that finds the average amount of time spent per week doing any physical activity.

display_name: Activity level per 2008 PA guidelines (categorical - 4 levels)
description: This variable that contains the level of physical activity per the 2008 PA guidelines.

display_name: Meets 2008 activity level guidelines
description: This variable determines whether or not high or medium activity level has been met based on variable gpaq_pag2008 (all counts).

display_name: Recreational physical activity (min/day)
description: This variable finds the total time per day doing some form of recreational physical activity.

display_name: Recreational physical (moderate) activity (min/day)
description: This variable calculates the average amount of time spent per day doing a moderate recreational physical activity.

display_name: Recreational physical (vigorous) activity (min/day)
description: This variable calculates the average amount of time spent per day doing a vigorous recreational physical activity.

display_name: Total physical activity (min/day)
description: This variable shows the average amount of time spent doing some form of physical activity in a week.

display_name: Total physical activity (MET-min/day)
description: This variable calculates the total amount of time spent doing some form of physical activity in a week.

display_name: Total physical (moderate) activity (min/day)
description: This variable finds the average amount of time spent per day doing moderate physical activity.

display_name: Total physical (vigorous) activity (min/day)
description: This variable finds the average amount of time spent per day doing vigorous physical activity.

display_name: Transportation-related physical activity (min/day)
description: This variable calculates the average amount of time spent per day walking or biking to and from a place.

display_name: GPAQ - Total physical (vigorous) activity (min/week)
description: This variable finds the average amount of time spent per week doing vigorous physical activity.

display_name: Work-related physical activity (min/day)
description: This variable finds the total time per day doing some form of work-related physical activity.

display_name: Work-related (moderate) physical activity (min/day)
description: This variable calculates the average amount of time spent per day doing a moderate work-related physical activity.

display_name: Work-related (vigorous) physical activity (min/day)
description: This variable calculates the average amount of time spent per day doing a vigorous work-related physical activity.

Cardiac Risk Ratio (TC/HDL) - AHA
description: This variable calculates the ratio of total cholesterol by HDL cholesterol.

display_name: Chronic Kidney Disease using eGFR only (NIDDK)
description: This variable estimated based on the estimated GFR value and is defined using NIDDK guidelines.

display_name: Dyslipidemia (High LDL, low HDL, or high triglyerides) - NIH
description: This variable checks for HDL, LDL, and triglyceride values to determine presence/absence of dyslipidemia.

display_name: eGFR based on serum creatinine, gender, age and race
description: This variable estimates Glomerular filtration rate, based on serum creatinine, and demographics gender, age and race (black vs. nonblack).

display_name: eGFR based on serum cystatin C w/o demographics
description: This variable estimates Glomerular filtration rate, based on serum cystatin C and no demographic factors.

display_name: eGFR based on serum cystatin C, serum creatinine, gender, age, and race
description: This variable estimates Glomerular filtration rate, based on serum cystatin C, serum creatinine, and demographics gender, age and race (black vs. nonblack).

display_name: Hypercholesterolemia (from LABA66,LABA68,LABA69,MED_LLD)
description: This variable checks for Total cholesterol, HDL, LDL, and antihyperlipidemic medication use values to determine presence/absence of hypercholesterolemia.

display_name: Insulin, fasting (calibrated, converted to mU/L)
description: This variable combines fasting glucose results from the central lab that was processed prior to July 5, 2010 (using units of mU/L) with results processed on or after July 5, 2010 (using units of pmol/L) and the overall units are converted to mU/L (1 mU/L = 6 pmol/L).

display_name: Insulin, post OGTT (calibrated, converted to mU/L)
description: This variable combines post OGTT glucose results from the central lab that were processed prior to July 5, 2010 (using units of mU/L) with results processed on or after July 5, 2010 (using units of pmol/L) and the overall units are converted to mU/L (1 mU/L = 6 pmol/L).

Digit Symbo Substitution Score (NEEA14)
description: This variable is for the score of the digit symbol substitution test. Only defined for participants who took a neurocognitive assessment (NEE form).

display_name: Major ECG Abnormalities
description: This variable is defined only for participants that have ECG data.

display_name: Minor ECG Abnormalities
description: This variable is defined only for participants that have ECG data.

display_name: No Diability on NEEA5-7
SEVTL, Sum of 3 Trials (NEEA8=10)
description: This variable is the sum of the scores of the first 3 trials of the SEVLT test. Only defined for participants who took a neurocognitive assessment (NEE form).

display_name: SEVLT, Delay Recall (NEEA11 with re-coding)
description: This variable is the scores of the 5th delayed recall trial of the SEVLT test. Definition per Dr. Hector Gonzalez. Only defined for participants who took a neurocognitive assessment (NEE form).

display_name: Total Score on 6 Item Screener (with re-coding)
description: This variable is the total score of the 6-item screener, which uses recoding of the original responses per definitions by Dr. Hector Gonzalez. It can take integer values from 0 to 6. Only defined for participants who took a neurocognitive assessment (NEE form).

display_name: Word Frequency (A+F) (NEEA12-13)
description: This variable is the sum of the score of the A and F parts of the Word Fluency test. Only defined for participants who took a neurocognitive assessment (NEE form).

display_name: CESD 10-item total summary score
description: This variable is the sum of (WBEA1-WBEA10), where positively worded items (WBEA5, WBEA8) are reverse coded.  For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, CESD10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.

display_name: CESD 10-item total summary score
description: This variable is the sum of (WBEA1-WBEA10), administered at the Sueno visit, where positively worded items (WBEA5, WBEA8) are reverse coded.  For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, CESD10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.

display_name: 10-Item State Trait Anxiety Inventory
description: This variable is the sum of (WBEA11-WBEA20), where positively worded items (WBEA12, WBEA17, WBEA19) are reverse coded, and 1 is added to all responses (converting from 0-3 to 1-4 scale to match the standardized instrument scoring). For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, STAI10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.

display_name: 10-Item State Trait Anxiety Inventory
description: This variable is the sum of (WBEA11-WBEA20), where positively worded items (WBEA12, WBEA17, WBEA19) are reverse coded, and 1 is added to all responses (converting from 0-3 to 1-4 scale to match the standardized instrument scoring). For participants with 1 or 2 missing items, STAI10 is equal to the weighted average of the nonmissing items*10.

display_name: Airflow Limitation (pre FEV1/FVC<70 only)
description: This variable is based on the empirical evidence from the spirometry that the ratio of  FEV1 to FVC is below the level defined by the ATS as indicative of restricted airflow. Defined only for valid spirometries.

display_name: Obstructive Lung Disease suspect
description: This variable is based on the empirical evidence from the spirometry that the ratio of  FEV1 to FVC is below the level defined by the ATS as indicative of restricted airflow.

description: This variable combines scanned/transcribed anti-asthmatic medication use with self-report asthma medication use.

display_name: Bronchodilator Responsive by 15% change
description: This variable is based on the post-bronchodilator measurement of the FEV1. The airflow remains restricted after the administration of albuterol the person did not respond by greater than a 15% improvement over their first measurement. If PRBA29 is not missing and POBA29 is not missing and PRBA29 > 0 then.

display_name: COPD by BD Test
description: This indicator of COPD is based on the post-bronchodilator measurement of the FEV1 to FVC ratio.  The airflow remains restricted after the administration of albuterol.

display_name: COPD by BD Test (for all valid PRE_BD)
description: This variable is based on the post-bronchodilator measurement of the FEV1 to FVC ratio. The airflow remains restricted after the administration of albuterol. This variable is also defined for all participants who did not conduct a post-spirometry exam. Defined only for valid spirometries.

display_name: Self-report of ever had COPD/Emph or CB
COPD Med Use - self/scanned (ever COPD by MD diag)
description: This variable combines scanned/transcribed anti-asthmatic medication use with self-report COPD medication use.

display_name: Self-report of ever had COPD/Emph
FEV1/FVC Ratio
description: This variable is the ratio of forced expiratory volume in one minute (FEV1 ) to forced vital capacity (FVC) expressed as a percentage.

display_name: Chronic Productive Cough 3+ mths in 2+ yrs
Phlegm day/night 3 months in a row
Pneumonia
Post-BD Expected (among valid spirometry
description: This variable is a flag for whether a post bronchodilator was expected, based on the premeasurement.  A post measurement was expected if the FEV1 to FVC ratio was less than 70% or less than the lower limit of normal for FEV1/FVC%.

display_name: Post(FEV1%pred)-Pre(FEV1%pred)
description: This variable is based on the ratio of the measured FEV1 difference from postbronchodilator and pre-bronchodilator exams over the Predicted FEV1 calculated prebronch (both values must be non-missing, and the post-bronchodilator spirometry examinations must be valid).

display_name: Post(FEV1%pred)-Pre(FEV1%pred)>=12% (pre FEV1/FVC<70 only)
description: This variable is based on the ratio of the measured FEV1 difference from postbronchodilator and pre-bronchodilator exams over the Predicted FEV1 calculated prebronch (both values must be non-missing, and the post-bronchodilator spirometry examination must be valid) among participants with pre FEV1/FVC<70 only (ignores LLN comparison).

display_name: Valid Spirometry Studies (Pre)
description: This variable is an overall data quality indicator derived by the pulmonary reading center on the adequacy study for use.

display_name: Valid Spirometry Studies (Post BD)
description: This variable is an overall data quality indicator derived by the pulmonary reading center on the adequacy study for use.

display_name: Valid post-spirometry (A-D grading) adjusted for unexpected BDs
description: This variable is a flag for whether a post bronchodilator was valid (grade A-D).  Defined only for participants where a post measurement was expected.

display_name: Wheezing in last 12 months
Wheezing ever with shortness of breath
Aggregate mental health score norm-based transformed
description: This sub-scale score is a norm-based transformation of standardized Z scores of the constituent items for the established domains which is scaled to a mean of 50 and standard deviation of 10.

display_name: Aggregate physical health score norm-based transformed
description: This sub-scale score is a norm-based transformation of standardized Z scores of the constituent items for the established domains which is scaled to a mean of 50 and standard deviation of 10.

description: Excessive daytime sleepiness, as defined as an ESS score greater than or equal to 10

description: The Epworth Sleepiness Scale, administered at the Sueno visit, assesses the daytime sleepiness of patients.

Average sleep duration (hours)
description: This is a numeric variable that calculates the average daily sleep duration during an entire week (five weekdays and two weekend days), using self-reported sleep data.

display_name: Average sleep duration
Weekday sleep duration (hours)
description: This is a numeric variable that calculates the self-reported sleep duration during weekdays.

display_name: Weekday sleep duration
Weekend sleep duration (hours)
description: This is a numeric variable that calculates the self-reported sleep duration during weekend days.

display_name: Weekend sleep duration
Valid actigraphy record
Womens's Health Initiative Insomnia Rating Scale
description: The score is calculated from non-missing values for any of the following five items: SLEA4, SLEA5, SLEA6, SLEA7 and SLEA11. The original items range from 0 to 4 and the total score from 0 to 20.  In HCHS/SOL, SLEA form the scoring for questions 4 to 7 each ranged from 1 to 5 so 1 should be subtracted from each of these items to obtain the score for use in calculating WHIIRS.

display_name: Women's Health Insomnia Rating Scale
Average sleep time from actigraphy
description: Weighted average for weekdays and weekends

display_name: Age
description: This is the age of the participant in years at the time of the participants clinic visit.

description: This variable is the grouped age of the participant.

description: This variable is the grouped age of the participant.

display_name: 6-Level Age Groups (NHANES standardization)
description: This variable is the grouped age of the participant. It is determined from the derived variable age for use with analyses requiring NHANES age standardization.

Education Status (2 levels)
description: This variable is the educational status derived from variable groups of the attainment of a high school diploma or an equivalent degree, or not having that degree.

display_name: Education Status (3 levels)
description: This variable is the educational status derived from variable groups of the attainment of a high school diploma or an equivalent degree, not having that degree, or attainment of education beyond a high school equivalent (i.e. college or vocational).

display_name: Employment Status (includes retirees)
description: This variable groups the employment status of the participant.

description: This variable describes the participants gender.

description: This variable describes the participants gender.

description: This derived variable groups each subjects marital status.

display_name: Health Insurance Coverage - Current
description: This variable groups the health insurance coverage status of the participant. The definition also checks whether or not any reason was giving for stopping coverage.

display_name: Current Occupation (collapsed categories)
description: This variable is the type of occupation the participant had at the time of the baseline examination.

display_name: Longest Held Occupation (collapsed categories)
description: This variable is the type of occupation the participant has held the longest.
